Companies find themselves in a pickle when their markets change.
sentences.cn: 公司在市场发生变化时会发现自己身陷困境。

sentences.en: Grandmother knew how to pickle cucumbers.
He found himself in a sad pickle.
sentences.cn: 他发现自己已处于困境.

sentences.en: How did you get yourself in this pickle?
sentences.cn: 你是怎么陷入这个困境的?

sentences.en: I thought shame even to speak with them in such a pickle of rags and dirt.
sentences.cn: 我想到自己是这么一副可怜相,衣服又破又脏,跟他们说话都觉得害臊.

sentences.en: Many a pickle makes a muckle.

sentences.cn: 酸洗液通常是一种含酸的水溶液,装在敞开的大槽中.

sentences.en: Select your favourite fruit or veg and pickle them while they are still fresh.
sentences.cn: 挑选最喜欢的水果或蔬菜，趁着新鲜把它们腌起来。

sentences.en: This means putting the food in pickle -- that is, in vinegar, salt water or some other solution.
sentences.cn: 就是把食物放在泡菜水 —— 醋 、 盐水或其它溶液里.

sentences.en: We can also pickle red cabbage.
sentences.cn: 我们也可以泡制红甘蓝.

sentences.en: We remove the scale by a process called pickle.
sentences.cn: 我们用一道叫做酸洗的工序来除去鳞片.

sentences.en: When there was nothing more to preserve, she began to pickle.
sentences.cn: 当没再有东西要保存时, 她就泡制酸菜.

words.tran_cn: 腌制的；盐渍的；烂醉如泥的

trans.tran_cn: 腌菜，泡菜，腌制食品，遇到麻烦，处于困境
trans.tran_en: a thick cold sauce that is made from pieces of vegetables preserved in vinegar. It is usually eaten with cold meat or cheese
to preserve food in  vinegar  or salt water
